meanings.definition: The deliberate termination of a human pregnancy.
meanings.sent1: She decided to have an abortion to end her pregnancy.
meanings.sent2: The debate on abortion rights continues to be a controversial topic.
meanings.sent3: When the cake fell apart, it was like an abortion of a baking project.
meanings.sent4: The cancellation of the event felt like an abortion of our weekend plans.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cut down the tree was an abortion of nature's beauty.

meanings.definition: The spontaneous expulsion of a fetus before it is able to survive independently.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the risks of a possible abortion of the fetus.
meanings.sent2: The miscarriage was a heartbreaking example of a natural abortion.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rainstorm felt like an abortion of the sunny picnic.
meanings.sent4: The early frost was like nature's own abortion of the crops.
meanings.sent5: The premature bloom of the flower was an abortion of its full potential.

meanings.definition: The failure of a plan or project.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected budget cut led to the abortion of the new initiative.
meanings.sent2: The team had to deal with the consequences of the project's abortion.
meanings.sent3: The last-minute change felt like an abortion of the original idea.
meanings.sent4: The storm's arrival was an abortion of our outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The technical glitch caused an abortion of the online presentation.
